column4: Can anyone just tell me under what conditions will Ubuntu create the default /home folders? I really have no idea how this could of happened.
Or why it would create them in the ecryptfs
when you create a new user you select if you want his /home/user dir to be encrytped,  this also is asked at first install of ubuntu for an admin account
well then I have no clue what happened. Ubuntu just decided to remake those folders in the encrypfs
there is a box to check in the user group gui that is used to select weather it's encyrpted or not
yeah but what I'm saying is that this user and it's encryptfs already existed. But ubuntu re-created the default folders in the home directory and the encrypfs even though they already existed
from an upgrade?  you can unencrypt the user or just create a new user that isn't encrypted and copy the /home/user to the new one
once I removed the default folders from the encrypfs and rebooted, I could access the folders again
No mention of anything in the logs about this
I've never seen it before.  maybe look at your apt-get log to see what you might have installed to triger the event
see  /var/log/dpkg.log to see your history around the time you see the changes
I can't see anything that would cause it to re-create the default /home folders in the /home/user/.Private/ folder
oh that sounds like a match then it's linked to upgrade
I disable all that auto upgrade stuf for this type of reason
yeah, but I don't get why an update would do this anyways.
